content.sourceTitle: What is the religion of Brock Lesnar.
content.text: Webster has nothing to say about religion. Even the speculative question and answer sites are stumped,

content.sourceTitle: What religion does brock lesnar have?
content.text: save one, where someone said he's a Christian.

I guess that could be true. He is, after all, a white American–most of which are Christian, at least in heritage. It seems unlikely that we can ever expect Lesnar to get into details about his religious views–if there are any. He said once:

content.sourceTitle: Lesnar separates public from private – UFC
content.text: I just don't put myself out there to the fans and prostitute my private life to everybody. In today's day and age, with the Internet and cameras and cell phones, I just like being old school and living in the woods and living my life.

content.sourceTitle: Brock Lesnar skirts immigration conference call with Cain Velasquez
content.text: Lesnar might be a bit political. He has been called an "unapologetic Republican,"
but nowhere can I find him being asked to apologize, let alone him saying he's a Republican.

content.sourceTitle: Millionaire Pro Athlete Brock Lesnar Makes the Case for American Health Care System
content.text: It wouldn't be surprising, though. He did go on an eight minute rant about how America's health care system was far superior to Canada's.
Seriously, Lesnar is quite unimpressed with Canadian health care–which is, to some degree, a model for the Democratic/liberal vision of American socialized health care.

content.sourceTitle: UFC fighter Brock Lesnar pleads guilty to Alberta hunting charge

content.text: so… there's all sorts of Republican associations: NRA, defenders of the 2nd amendment, etc. He's probably not a member of PETA…
